member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1Maps

remarks.para: In order for C1Maps to be able to access tiles over the internet, the Silverlight application must be hosted in a Web server. If the Silverlight application is run directly from the local disk, the Silverlight runtime prevents it from accessing internet resources.
Note that geographic coordinates are represented using structures. The X property of Point is the longitude and the Y property is the latitude.

member.summary: Displays a map with layers of content above it.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MapVirtualLayer.Slices
member.summary: Gets the collection of specifying how the map is partitioned for virtualization.
member.remarks: Each defines a set of regions this C1MapVirtualLayer will get items for when needed. The minimum zoom of a MapSlice is the value of its property, while the maximum zoom is the value from the Zoom property of the next slice. Each slice divides the map in a uniform grid of regions according to the current .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MultiScaleImage.FadeInTiles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tiles fade in on load.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MultiScaleImage.TilesLoadProgress
member.summary: Fires when the number of tiles that need to be loaded changes.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MultiScaleImage.ViewportOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-left corner of the area of the image to be displayed.
member.remarks: The point of the top-left corner of the rectangular area of the image to be displayed. The coordinates of the point are in local coordinates (0-1) relative to the displayed image. For example, a ViewportOrigin point value of 1,1 would specify an origin on the lower right-hand corner of the image. Because this origin is for the top-left corner of the rectangular area of the image displayed, a value of 1, 1 would actually show nothing of the image (area would be lower and to the right of the image). As another example, a point at 0.5, 0.5 would be directly in the center of the image and therefore the area shown would be to the lower-right of the image center.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MultiScaleImage.ViewportWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the area of the image displayed.
member.remarks: The width of the area of the image displayed. This value is in logical coordinates. For example a value of 1 displays the entire image (no zoom), a value of 0.5 is 200% zoomed in and a value of 0 is completely zoomed (user cannot see the image at all). A value above 1 is zooming out from the image. For example, a value of 2 means that the image will take up half the size of the System.Windows.Controls.MultiScaleImage control area (50% zoom).

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1MultiScaleImage.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to obtain the Uris of the tiles.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmlReader
member.summary: Contains methods for importing KML and KMZ files.
member.remarks:
KML is a popular XML-based language used for representing geographic information.
There are several tools available for creating, editing, and viewing KML files.
There are also several sources of free and commercial KML and KMZ files, including for example www.geocommons.com and www.esri.com.
KMZ is also a popular format which consists of zipped KML, and is also supported by the class. The class has static methods that create collections of vector objects from the supplied KML or KMZ source. These objects can then be added to a and placed on the map.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmlReader.Read(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read kml data from stream.
member.param: Stream that contains KML data.
member.returns: List of vector objects for C1VectorLayer.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmlReader.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Read kml data from string.
member.param: String that contains KML data.
member.returns: List of vector objects for C1VectorLayer.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.SaveElementCallback
member.summary: Callback for KmlWriter.Write method.
member.param: Vector for writing.
Created xml element.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmlWriter
member.summary: Contains methods for KML export.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmlWriter.Write(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{C1.Silverlight.Maps.C1VectorItemBase},System.String,C1.Silverlight.Maps.SaveElementCallback)
member.summary: Saves a collection of C1VectorItems into the stream as KML placemarks.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.KmzReader

member.param: Stream that contains KMZ data.
member.returns: The list of imported vector objects.

member.summary: When the pixel size of element is less than MinSize the element is not visible.

member.summary: When the pixel size of element is greater than MaxSize the element is not visible.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.LOD.MinZoom
member.summary: When the map zoom is less than MinZoom the element is not visible.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.Maps.LOD.MaxZoom
member.summary: When the map zoom is greater than MaxZoom the element is not visible.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Maps.QuadTreeTileSource
member.summary: Base class for implementation accessing a quad tree of tiles.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.Maps.QuadTreeTileSource.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new QuadTreeTileSource.
member.param: A string with the format of the tile URLs. It must have two string.Format place holder. The first is for the server number (a random number from 0 to 3), the second parameter is the quad tree access string.
A four character string containing the characters for the tiles in the following order: upper left, lower left, upper right and lower right.
The side length in pixels of the source image at the maximum zoom level.
The side length, in pixels, of a tile.
